title: 107_hr1098
content: The "Maritime Policy Improvement Act of 2001" includes provisions for various vessels such as COASTAL VENTURE and ASPHALT COMMANDER, as well as amendments related to maritime liens and documentation certificates. Expansion of American Merchant Marine Memorial Wall of Honor. The Congress acknowledges the significant role of the United States Merchant Marine in various wars, including serving as the Nation's first navy, keeping the lifeline of freedom open during World War II, and being praised as the "Fourth Arm of Defense" by President Roosevelt. Over 250,000 men and women served in the Merchant Marine during World War II. During World War II, the United States Merchant Marine faced dangers from submarines, mines, armed raiders, and aircraft. Over 6,800 members were killed at sea, 11,000 were wounded, and 604 were taken prisoner. During World War II, the United States Merchant Marine faced significant dangers, with 604 members taken prisoner and 1 in 32 dying in the line of duty. The Merchant Marine continues to serve the US, promoting freedom and honoring its former members. The Secretary of Transportation may grant funds to the American Merchant Marine Veterans Memorial Committee to add to the Memorial Wall of Honor in California. The American Merchant Marine Veterans Memorial Committee is granted funds to add to the Memorial Wall of Honor in California. The Federal share of the cost is 50 percent, with an authorization of $500,000 for fiscal year 2002. SEC. 5. DISCHARGE OF AGRICULTURAL CARGO RESIDUE. The discharge of agricultural cargo residue from a vessel shall be governed by the Act to Prevent Pollution from Ships. SEC. 6. RECORDING AND DISCHARGING MARITIME LIENS. Section 31343 of title 46, United States Code is amended to allow for the recording and discharging of liens on documented vessels. The Secretary must record a notice complying with the section if a declaration stating the information is true and correct is filed with the notice. The individual filing a notice of claim on a vessel must declare the information is true and send copies to the vessel owner, previous lien holders, and mortgagees. Declarations from non-individuals must be signed by authorized representatives. On full discharge of vessel indebtedness, a certificate must be provided to the Secretary for recording. District courts have jurisdiction over civil actions regarding vessel liens. The district courts have jurisdiction over civil actions related to vessel liens. A notice of claim of lien recorded under subsection (b) expires after 3 years. This section does not change the law on establishing maritime liens or the remedies available. The district courts have jurisdiction over civil actions related to vessel liens. A notice of claim of lien recorded under subsection (b) expires after 3 years. This section does not alter the law on establishing maritime liens, remedies, or defenses, including the defense of laches. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in title 46, United States Code. Section 31343 of title 46, United States Code is amended to include notice requirements for recording and discharging liens. Additionally, Section 12111 is amended to specify that the Secretary cannot refuse to approve the surrender of documentation for a vessel based solely on a recorded notice of a lien. Section 31343 of title 46, United States Code is amended to include notice requirements for recording and discharging liens. The Secretary may condition approval of the surrender of the certificate of documentation for a vessel over 1,000 gross tons. A technical correction is made to Section 9(c) of the Shipping Act, 1916. This section shall take effect on July 1, 2002. The Secretary of Transportation will determine the tonnage measurement for the small passenger vessel R/V DAVIDSON for regulatory purposes. This measurement applies when the vessel complies with specific requirements. Additionally, there are provisions for miscellaneous certificates of documentation. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation for vessels like LOOKING GLASS, YANKEE, LUCKY DOG, ENTERPRIZE, M/V SANDPIPER, FRITHA, PUFFIN, and VICTORY OF BURNHAM for coastwise trade. The vessels eligible for certificates of documentation for coastwise trade include FRITHA, PUFFIN, VICTORY OF BURNHAM, R'ADVENTURE II, ANTJA, SKIMMER, TOKEENA, DOUBLE EAGLE2, ENCOUNTER, AJ, BARGE 10, NOT A SHOT, and PRIDE OF MANY. The vessels eligible for certificates of documentation for coastwise trade include NOT A SHOT (United States official number 911064), PRIDE OF MANY (Canadian official number 811529), AMAZING GRACE (United States official number 92769), and SHEWHO (United States official number 1104094). SEC. 9. EXEMPTION FOR VICTORY SHIPS. Amends Section 3302(l)(1) of title 46, United States Code to exempt the SS Red Oak Victory and SS American Victory. SEC. 10. CERTIFICATE OF DOCUMENTATION FOR 3 BARGES. The Secretary of Transportation may issue a certificate of documentation for employment in coastwise trade for specific vessels, including former Navy and railroad car barges with certain dimensions. These vessels are limited to use as floating entities. The Secretary of Transportation may issue a certificate of documentation for vessels with specific dimensions, limited to use as floating platforms for launching fireworks. The Secretary of Transportation may issue a certificate of documentation for vessels limited to use as floating platforms for launching fireworks. The Secretary of Transportation will issue a certificate of documentation for the vessel EAGLE for coastwise trade if owned or chartered by a State entity, and operated for specific purposes like scour jet operations or dredging services. The vessel EAGLE can receive a certificate of documentation for coastwise trade if owned or chartered by a State entity and used for scour jet operations or dredging services near State-owned facilities. SEC. 12. WAIVER FOR VESSELS IN NEW WORLD CHALLENGE RACE. Beginning April 1, 2002, 10 sailboats in the race can transport guests without payment until 60 days after the race ends or December 31, 2003. SEC. 13. VESSEL ASPHALT COMMANDER may be transferred to a foreign registry or sold to a non-US citizen.
